name: Tapioca
description: A traditional Brazilian dish made from tapioca flour, filled with various sweet or savory ingredients.

name: Feijoada
description: A rich, hearty stew made with black beans, pork, and beef, traditionally served with rice and orange slices.

name: Cuscuz
description: A steamed dish made from cornmeal, often mixed with vegetables, meats, or seafood.

name: Moqueca
description: A flavorful Brazilian seafood stew made with fish, coconut milk, tomatoes, and spices.

name: Baião de Dois
description: A traditional dish from the Northeastern region of Brazil, made with rice, beans, and dried meat.

name: Cozido
description: A hearty Brazilian stew made with various meats, vegetables, and spices.

name: Cartola
description: A sweet dessert made from fried bananas, cheese, sugar, and cinnamon.

name: Bolo Souza Leão
description: A traditional Brazilian cake made from tapioca flour, coconut milk, and sugar.

name: Pudim
description: A creamy Brazilian flan made with condensed milk, eggs, and caramel.

name: Churrasco
description: Brazilian barbecue featuring various cuts of meat grilled to perfection.

name: Açaí
description: A refreshing dish made from frozen açaí berries, often served with granola and fruit.

name: Salpicão
description: A Brazilian chicken salad with vegetables, raisins, and a mayonnaise-based dressing.

name: Pão de Queijo
description: Chewy and cheesy bread rolls made from tapioca flour and cheese.

name: Acarajé
description: Deep-fried balls made from black-eyed pea dough, filled with shrimp and spicy pastes.

name: Caruru
description: A dish made with okra, dried shrimp, and spices, traditionally served with acarajé.

name: Sururu de Capote
description: A traditional Brazilian dish made with sururu clams cooked in coconut milk and spices.

name: Dadinho de Tapioca
description: Small fried cubes made from tapioca and cheese, often served with a spicy sauce.

name: Escondidinho
description: A layered dish with mashed cassava and a filling of meat, chicken, or shrimp.

name: Tacacá
description: A traditional soup from the Amazon region made with tucupi (a yellow broth), jambu (a local herb), and dried shrimp.

name: Pé de Moleque
description: A traditional Brazilian sweet made from peanuts and molasses or sugar syrup.

name: Canjica
description: A sweet dish made with hominy corn, milk, sugar, and cinnamon.
